required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Evaluation Of The Efficacy Of The Combination Of Axitinib With Pemetrexed And Cisplatin In The Treatment Of Non-Squamous Non-Small Cell Lung Cancer
clinical_study.official_title: Randomized Phase 2 Study Of Cisplatin/Pemetrexed With Or Without Axitinib (AG-013736) As First-Line Treatment For Patients With Non-Squamous Non-Small Cell Lung Cancer

brief_summary.textblock: AG-013736 (axitinib) in combination with cisplatin and pemetrexed will be evaluated as first-line treatment of patients with locally advanced, recurrent, or metastatic non-squamous, non small cell lung cancer (NSCLC).

primary_outcome.time_frame: Phase 2 baseline until the date of first documented progression or death due to any cause or initiation of subsequent anticancer therapy, assessed every 6 weeks up to 84 weeks
primary_outcome.description: Time in months from the date of randomization to first documentation of objective tumor progression or death due to any cause. PFS was calculated as (first event date minus minus the date of randomization plus 1) divided by 30.4. Tumor progression was determined from oncologic assessment data (where data meet the criteria for progressive disease [PD]); death was determined from AE data (where the outcome was "Death") or from the end of study data.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline until death or collected bimonthly following discontinuation of study treatment until at least 1 year after randomization of the last participant
secondary_outcome.description: Time in months from the date of randomization to date of death due to any cause. OS was calculated as (the death date minus the date of randomization plus 1) divided by 30.4. Death was determined from AE data (where outcome was death) or from follow-up contact data (where the participant current status was death).

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Objective Response (OR)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Phase 2 baseline until the date of first documented progression or discontinuation from the study due to any cause or initiation of subsequent anticancer therapy, assessed every 6 weeks up to 84 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: Percentage of participants with OR based assessment of confirmed complete response (CR)/confirmed partial response (PR) according to Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors(RECIST).Confirmed responses: those persist on repeat imaging study at least 4 weeks after initial documentation of response.CR: disappearance of all lesions (target/non target) and no appearance of new lesions.PR: those with at least 30 % decrease in sum of longest dimensions of target lesions taking as reference baseline sum longest dimensions,without progression of non target lesions and no appearance of new lesions.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Phase 2 baseline until the date of first documented progression or discontinuation from the study due to any cause or initiation of subsequent anticancer therapy, assessed every 6 weeks up to 84 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: Time in months from the first documentation of objective tumor response to objective tumor progression or death due to any cause, whichever occurs first. Duration of tumor response was calculated as (the date of the first documentation of objective tumor progression or death due to cause minus the date of the first CR or PR that was subsequently confirmed plus 1) divided by 30.4. DR was calculated for the subgroup of participants with a confirmed objective tumor response.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Monroe Dunaway (MD) Anderson Symptom Inventory (MDASI) Symptom Severity Score
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Phase 2 baseline (Cycle1/Day1), Cycle1/Day8, then Day 1 and 8 of each cycle of chemotherapy (C) up to CycleC6, Day 1 of each cycle of single-agent phase (A) up to CycleA8 and end of treatment (EOT)
secondary_outcome.description: Symptom severity score is comprised of average of 13 MDASI core items (pain, fatigue, nausea, disturbed sleep, distressed, shortness of breath, remembering things, lack of appetite, drowsy, dry mouth, sadness, vomiting, numbness or tingling) and ranges from 0 to 10. Participants were asked to rate severity of each symptom at their worst in last 24 hours; each item rated from 0 to 10, with 0 = symptom not present and 10 = as bad as you can imagine. Lower scores indicated better outcome.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Monroe Dunaway (MD) Anderson Symptom Inventory (MDASI) Symptom Interference Score
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Phase 2 baseline (Cycle1/Day1), Cycle1/Day8, then Day 1 and 8 of each cycle of chemotherapy (C) up to CycleC6, Day 1 of each cycle of single-agent phase (A) up to CycleA8 and EOT
secondary_outcome.description: Symptom interference score is comprised of average of 6 function items from MDASI core (general activity, mood, work, relations with others, walking, and enjoyment of life) and ranges from 0 to 10. Participants were asked to rate how much symptoms have interfered in last 24 hours; each item rated from 0 to 10, with 0 = did not interfere and 10 = interfered completely. Lower scores indicated better outcome.

arm_group.description: Axitinib (continuous) + Pemetrexed(500mg/m2)/Cisplatin(75mg/m2) x max 6 cycles followed by axitinib maintenance
Axitinib (modified) + Pemetrexed(500mg/m2)/Cisplatin(75mg/m2) x max 6 cycles followed by axitinib maintenance
Axitinib interrupted before each chemo cycle (Pemetrexed(500mg/m2)/Cisplatin(75mg/m2) x max 6 cycles followed by axitinib maintenance

intervention.description: 5mg BID po up to max 10mg BID po
5mg BID po up to max 10mg BID po paused for 3 days before each cycle of concomitant chemotherapy
5mg BID po up to max 10mg BID po paused before each concomitant chemotherapy

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Histologically or cytologically confirmed diagnosis of adeno-, large cell or bronchioalveolar non-small cell lung cancer
- Cytologic specimens for diagnosis or for cell type classification must have been obtained from bronchial brushings or washings or from needle aspiration of a defined lesion. Sputum cytology alone will not be acceptable for diagnosis or for cell type classification.
- Patients with mixed NSCLC with predominantly squamous cell carcinoma should be classified as squamous and thus do not qualify for this study.
- Stage IIIB with malignant effusion (with cytologic confirmation of malignant pleural or pericardial effusion), Stage IV, or recurrent disease after definitive loco-regional therapy.
- Candidate for primary treatment with cisplatin and pemetrexed
Exclusion Criteria:
- Any histological/cytological evidence of predominantly squamous NSCLC.
- Small cell or carcinoid lung cancer patients are also ineligible.
- NSCLC that cannot be classified as one of the eligible histologies (adenocarcinoma, large cell or bronchioalveolar).
- Prior systemic therapy for Stage IIIB (with malignant effusion), Stage IV, or recurrent NSCLC. (Prior treatment with systemic therapy as adjuvant chemotherapy or in conjunction with radiotherapy for Stage II or III NSCLC is permitted if the last dose of chemotherapy was completed 12 months or more prior to randomization).
- Prior treatment with a VEGF or VEGFR inhibitor.

link.description: To obtain contact information for a study center near you, click here.

group.title: Axitinib + Pemetrexed/Cisplatin (Phase 1)
group.description: Lead-in axitinib (AG-013736) tablet at a starting dose of 5 milligram (mg) orally twice daily (BID) from Day -5, -4 or -3 till Day 18 of Cycle 1 then continuously from Day 3 of Cycle 2 along with pemetrexed 500 milligram per square meter (mg/m^2) infusion and cisplatin 75 mg/m^2 infusion over a 2 hour period on Day 1 of each cycle up to 6 cycles of length 21 days each in chemotherapy phase and axitinib (AG-013736) tablet 5 mg orally BID in single-agent maintenance phase. Treatment was continued until progression of disease, unmanageable adverse events (AEs), or participant withdrawal.

group.title: Axitinib (Continuous) + Pemetrexed/Cisplatin (Phase 2)
group.description: Axitinib (AG-013736) tablet at a starting dose of 5 mg orally BID along with pemetrexed 500 mg/m^2 infusion and cisplatin 75 mg/m^2 infusion over a 2 hour period on Day 1 of each cycle up to 6 cycles of length 21 days each in chemotherapy phase and axitinib (AG-013736) tablet 5 mg orally BID in single-agent maintenance phase. Treatment was continued until progression of disease, unmanageable AEs, or participant withdrawal.

group.title: Axitinib (Modified) + Pemetrexed/Cisplatin (Phase 2)
group.description: Axitinib (AG-013736) tablet at a starting dose of 5 mg orally BID from Day 2-19 in cycles of chemotherapy phase, except the last cycle, where axitinib (AG-013736) was administered on Day 2-21 along with pemetrexed 500 mg/m^2 infusion and cisplatin 75 mg/m^2 infusion over a 2 hour period on Day 1 of each cycle up to 6 cycles of length 21 days each in chemotherapy phase and axitinib (AG-013736) tablet 5 mg orally BID in single-agent maintenance phase. Treatment was continued until progression of disease, unmanageable AEs, or participant withdrawal.

group.title: Pemetrexed/Cisplatin (Phase 2)
group.description: Pemetrexed 500 mg/m^2 infusion and cisplatin 75 mg/m^2 infusion over a 2 hour period on Day 1 of each cycle up to 6 cycles of length 21 days each in chemotherapy phase. Treatment was continued until progression of disease, unmanageable AEs, or participant withdrawal.

class.title: Greater Than or Equal to 65 Years

outcome.title: Progression-Free Survival (PFS)
outcome.description: Time in months from the date of randomization to first documentation of objective tumor progression or death due to any cause. PFS was calculated as (first event date minus minus the date of randomization plus 1) divided by 30.4. Tumor progression was determined from oncologic assessment data (where data meet the criteria for progressive disease [PD]); death was determined from AE data (where the outcome was "Death") or from the end of study data.
outcome.time_frame: Phase 2 baseline until the date of first documented progression or death due to any cause or initiation of subsequent anticancer therapy, assessed every 6 weeks up to 84 weeks
outcome.population: Full analysis (FA) population, included all participants randomized with study medication assignment designated according to initial randomization, regardless of whether participants received study medication or received a different drug from that to which they were randomized.

measure.title: Progression-Free Survival (PFS)
measure.description: Time in months from the date of randomization to first documentation of objective tumor progression or death due to any cause. PFS was calculated as (first event date minus minus the date of randomization plus 1) divided by 30.4. Tumor progression was determined from oncologic assessment data (where data meet the criteria for progressive disease [PD]); death was determined from AE data (where the outcome was "Death") or from the end of study data.
measure.population: Full analysis (FA) population, included all participants randomized with study medication assignment designated according to initial randomization, regardless of whether participants received study medication or received a different drug from that to which they were randomized.

analysis.groups_desc: P-value was calculated using 1-sided log rank test, stratified by Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group (ECOG) performance status (0 or 1) and gender (male or female). Hazard ratio (HR): the stratified Cox model was fitted, using the same stratification variables as above.
analysis.method_desc: One-sided log-rank test at alpha = 0.20 significance level was used.

analysis.groups_desc: P-value was calculated using 1-sided log rank test, stratified by ECOG performance status (0 or 1) and gender (male or female). HR: the stratified Cox model was fitted, using the same stratification variables as above.
analysis.method_desc: One-sided log-rank test at alpha = 0.20 significance level was used.

outcome.title: Overall Survival (OS)
outcome.description: Time in months from the date of randomization to date of death due to any cause. OS was calculated as (the death date minus the date of randomization plus 1) divided by 30.4. Death was determined from AE data (where outcome was death) or from follow-up contact data (where the participant current status was death).
outcome.time_frame: Baseline until death or collected bimonthly following discontinuation of study treatment until at least 1 year after randomization of the last participant
outcome.population: FA population, included all participants randomized with study medication assignment designated according to initial randomization, regardless of whether participants received study medication or received a different drug from that to which they were randomized.

Death was determined from AE data (where outcome was death) or from follow-up contact data (where the participant current status was death).
measure.population: FA population, included all participants randomized with study medication assignment designated according to initial randomization, regardless of whether participants received study medication or received a different drug from that to which they were randomized.

measurement_list.measurement: Upper limit of confidence interval (C.I.) was not estimable due to insufficient events as there were few data points.

analysis.groups_desc: P-value was calculated using 1-sided log rank test, stratified by ECOG performance status (0 or 1) and gender (male or female). HR: the stratified Cox model was fitted, using the same stratification variables as above.
analysis.method_desc: One-sided log-rank test at alpha = 0.20 significance level was used.

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants With Objective Response (OR)
outcome.description: Percentage of participants with OR based assessment of confirmed complete response (CR)/confirmed partial response (PR) according to Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors(RECIST).Confirmed responses: those persist on repeat imaging study at least 4 weeks after initial documentation of response.CR: disappearance of all lesions (target/non target) and no appearance of new lesions.PR: those with at least 30 % decrease in sum of longest dimensions of target lesions taking as reference baseline sum longest dimensions,without progression of non target lesions and no appearance of new lesions.
outcome.time_frame: Phase 2 baseline until the date of first documented progression or discontinuation from the study due to any cause or initiation of subsequent anticancer therapy, assessed every 6 weeks up to 84 weeks
outcome.population: FA population, included all participants randomized with study medication assignment designated according to initial randomization, regardless of whether participants received study medication or received a different drug from that to which they were randomized.

group.title: Pemetrexed/Cisplatin (Phase 2)

measure.title: Percentage of Participants With Objective Response (OR)
measure.description: Percentage of participants with OR based assessment of confirmed complete response (CR)/confirmed partial response (PR) according to Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors(RECIST).Confirmed responses: those persist on repeat imaging study at least 4 weeks after initial documentation of response.CR: disappearance of all lesions (target/non target) and no appearance of new lesions.PR: those with at least 30 % decrease in sum of longest dimensions of target lesions taking as reference baseline sum longest dimensions,without progression of non target lesions and no appearance of new lesions.
measure.population: FA population, included all participants randomized with study medication assignment designated according to initial randomization, regardless of whether participants received study medication or received a different drug from that to which they were randomized.

analysis.groups_desc: P-value was calculated using Cochran-Mantel-Haenszel (CMH) test stratified by ECOG performance status (0 or 1) and gender (male or female).
P-value was calculated using CMH test stratified by ECOG performance status (0 or 1) and gender (male or female).

outcome.title: Duration of Response (DR)
outcome.description: Time in months from the first documentation of objective tumor response to objective tumor progression or death due to any cause, whichever occurs first. Duration of tumor response was calculated as (the date of the first documentation of objective tumor progression or death due to cause minus the date of the first CR or PR that was subsequently confirmed plus 1) divided by 30.4. DR was calculated for the subgroup of participants with a confirmed objective tumor response.
outcome.time_frame: Phase 2 baseline until the date of first documented progression or discontinuation from the study due to any cause or initiation of subsequent anticancer therapy, assessed every 6 weeks up to 84 weeks
outcome.population: Subgroup of participants from the FA population with a confirmed objective tumor response (CR or PR).

group.title: Axitinib (Continuous) + Pemetrexed/Cisplatin (Phase 2)
group.description: Axitinib (AG-013736) tablet at a starting dose of 5 mg orally BID along with pemetrexed 500 mg/m^2 infusion and cisplatin 75 mg/m^2 infusion over a 2 hour period on Day 1 of each cycle up to 6 cycles of length 21 days each in chemotherapy phase and axitinib (AG-013736) tablet 5 mg orally BID in single-agent maintenance phase. Treatment was continued until progression of disease, unmanageable AEs, or participant withdrawal.

group.title: Axitinib (Modified) + Pemetrexed/Cisplatin (Phase 2)
group.description: Axitinib (AG-013736) tablet at a starting dose of 5 mg orally BID from Day 2-19 in cycles of chemotherapy phase, except the last cycle, where axitinib (AG-013736) was administered on Day 2-21 along with pemetrexed 500 mg/m^2 infusion and cisplatin 75 mg/m^2 infusion over a 2 hour period on Day 1 of each cycle up to 6 cycles of length 21 days each in chemotherapy phase and axitinib (AG-013736) tablet 5 mg orally BID in single-agent maintenance phase. Treatment was continued until progression of disease, unmanageable AEs, or participant withdrawal.

group.title: Pemetrexed/Cisplatin (Phase 2)
group.description: Pemetrexed 500 mg/m^2 infusion and cisplatin 75 mg/m^2 infusion over a 2 hour period on Day 1 of each cycle up to 6 cycles of length 21 days each in chemotherapy phase. Treatment was continued until progression of disease, unmanageable AEs, or participant withdrawal.

measure.title: Duration of Response (DR)
measure.description: Time in months from the first documentation of objective tumor response to objective tumor progression or death due to any cause, whichever occurs first. Duration of tumor response was calculated as (the date of the first documentation of objective tumor progression or death due to cause minus the date of the first CR or PR that was subsequently confirmed plus 1) divided by 30.4. DR was calculated for the subgroup of participants with a confirmed objective tumor response.
measure.population: Subgroup of participants from the FA population with a confirmed objective tumor response (CR or PR).

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in Monroe Dunaway (MD) Anderson Symptom Inventory (MDASI) Symptom Severity Score
outcome.description: Symptom severity score is comprised of average of 13 MDASI core items (pain, fatigue, nausea, disturbed sleep, distressed, shortness of breath, remembering things, lack of appetite, drowsy, dry mouth, sadness, vomiting, numbness or tingling) and ranges from 0 to 10. Participants were asked to rate severity of each symptom at their worst in last 24 hours; each item rated from 0 to 10, with 0 = symptom not present and 10 = as bad as you can imagine. Lower scores indicated better outcome.
outcome.time_frame: Phase 2 baseline (Cycle1/Day1), Cycle1/Day8, then Day 1 and 8 of each cycle of chemotherapy (C) up to CycleC6, Day 1 of each cycle of single-agent phase (A) up to CycleA8 and end of treatment (EOT)
outcome.population: FA population; N (number of participants analyzed) signifies participants evaluable for this measure and n is number of participants analyzed at specific time point for each treatment arm respectively.

group.title: Axitinib (Continuous) + Pemetrexed/Cisplatin (Phase 2)
group.description: Axitinib (AG-013736) tablet at a starting dose of 5 mg orally BID along with pemetrexed 500 mg/m^2 infusion and cisplatin 75 mg/m^2 infusion over a 2 hour period on Day 1 of each cycle up to 6 cycles of length 21 days each in chemotherapy phase and axitinib (AG-013736) tablet 5 mg orally BID in single-agent maintenance phase. measure.description: Symptom severity score is comprised of average of 13 MDASI core items (pain, fatigue, nausea, disturbed sleep, distressed, shortness of breath, remembering things, lack of appetite, drowsy, dry mouth, sadness, vomiting, numbness or tingling) and ranges from 0 to 10. Participants were asked to rate severity of each symptom at their worst in last 24 hours; each item rated from 0 to 10, with 0 = symptom not present and 10 = as bad as you can imagine. Lower scores indicated better outcome.
measure.population: FA population; N (number of participants analyzed) signifies participants evaluable for this measure and n is number of participants analyzed at specific time point for each treatment arm respectively.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in Monroe Dunaway (MD) Anderson Symptom Inventory (MDASI) Symptom Interference Score
outcome.description: Symptom interference score is comprised of average of 6 function items from MDASI core (general activity, mood, work, relations with others, walking, and enjoyment of life) and ranges from 0 to 10. Participants were asked to rate how much symptoms have interfered in last 24 hours; each item rated from 0 to 10, with 0 = did not interfere and 10 = interfered completely. Lower scores indicated better outcome.

outcome.population: FA population; N (number of participants analyzed) signifies participants evaluable for this measure and n is number of participants analyzed at specific time point for each treatment arm respectively.

measure.description: Symptom interference score is comprised of average of 6 function items from MDASI core (general activity, mood, work, relations with others, walking, and enjoyment of life) and ranges from 0 to 10. Participants were asked to rate how much symptoms have interfered in last 24 hours; each item rated from 0 to 10, with 0 = did not interfere and 10 = interfered completely. Lower scores indicated better outcome.
measure.population: FA population; N (number of participants analyzed) signifies participants evaluable for this measure and n is number of participants analyzed at specific time point for each treatment arm respectively.

measurement_list.measurement: Data was not summarized because there was insufficient number of participants to calculate change from baseline at visit.

reported_events.desc: The same event may appear as both an AE and a SAE. However, what is presented are distinct events. An event may be categorized as serious in one subject and as nonserious in another subject, or one subject may have experienced both a serious and nonserious event during the study.

group.title: Axitinib + Pemetrexed/Cisplatin (Phase 1)
group.description: Lead-in axitinib (AG-013736) tablet at a starting dose of 5 milligram (mg) orally twice daily (BID) from Day -5, -4 or -3 till Day 18 of Cycle 1 then continuously from Day 3 of Cycle 2 along with pemetrexed 500 milligram per square meter (mg/m^2) infusion and cisplatin 75 mg/m^2 infusion over a 2 hour period on Day 1 of each cycle up to 6 cycles of length 21 days each in chemotherapy phase and axitinib (AG-013736) tablet 5 mg orally BID in single-agent maintenance phase. Treatment was continued until progression of disease, unmanageable adverse events (AEs), or participant withdrawal.

group.title: Axitinib (Continuous) + Pemetrexed/Cisplatin (Phase 2)
group.description: Axitinib (AG-013736) tablet at a starting dose of 5 mg orally BID along with pemetrexed 500 mg/m^2 infusion and cisplatin 75 mg/m^2 infusion over a 2 hour period on Day 1 of each cycle up to 6 cycles of length 21 days each in chemotherapy phase and axitinib (AG-013736) tablet 5 mg orally BID in single-agent maintenance phase. Treatment was continued until progression of disease, unmanageable AEs, or participant withdrawal.

group.title: Axitinib (Modified) + Pemetrexed/Cisplatin (Phase 2)
group.description: Axitinib (AG-013736) tablet at a starting dose of 5 mg orally BID from Day 2-19 in cycles of chemotherapy phase, except the last cycle, where axitinib (AG-013736) was administered on Day 2-21 along with pemetrexed 500 mg/m^2 infusion and cisplatin 75 mg/m^2 infusion over a 2 hour period on Day 1 of each cycle up to 6 cycles of length 21 days each in chemotherapy phase and axitinib (AG-013736) tablet 5 mg orally BID in single-agent maintenance phase. Treatment was continued until progression of disease, unmanageable AEs, or participant withdrawal.

group.title: Pemetrexed/Cisplatin (Phase 2)
group.description: Pemetrexed 500 mg/m^2 infusion and cisplatin 75 mg/m^2 infusion over a 2 hour period on Day 1 of each cycle up to 6 cycles of length 21 days each in chemotherapy phase. Treatment was continued until progression of disease, unmanageable AEs, or participant withdrawal.

category.title: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Pfizer has the right to review disclosures, requesting a delay of less than 60 days. Investigator will postpone single center publications until after disclosure of pooled data (all sites), less than 12 months from study completion/termination at all participating sites. Investigator may not disclose previously undisclosed confidential information other than study results.
